msDesc.head: Miscellany of Sermons and Saints' Lives. Germany, s. xiii2.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 800–865. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.title: Expositio missae
msItem.note: A summary of Bertold of Regensburg, Expositio, which forms part of his Rusticanus de dominicis (ed.: Franz, Messe, 742, l. 1-745).

msItem.title: Theological texts
msItem.note: De oboedientia. Several textual units, presumably ending on fol. 2rb.

msItem.title: Saints' lives
msItem.note: Some of the texts identical with Jacobus de Voragine, Legenda aurea (ed.: Maggioni, 2 vols; - Kaeppeli 2154) or Bartholomew of Trent, Liber epilogorum in gesta sanctorum (ed. E. Paoli, Edizione nazionale dei testi mediolatini 2, serie I, i (Florence, 2001; the rest mostly anonymous. For full item listing, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles, partly based on or excerpted from Caesarius of Heisterbach, Dialogus miraculorum (ed.: J. Strange (Cologne 1851); ed. N. Nörges & H. Schneider, Fontes Christiani 86 (2009)) and Liber octo miraculorum (ed.: A. Hilka, Die Wundergeschichten des Caesarius von Heisterbach (Bonn 1937)).

msItem.title: Biblical extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates, from the Bible: Proverbs, Sirach, Ecclesiastes, Job and Isaiah; the first one not identifiable.

msItem.title: Short exempla and sermons
msItem.note: For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Vita s. Odiliae virginis
msItem.note: (ed.: AB 13 (1894) 9-16, l. 12; 18, l. 4-32; ed. W. Levison, MGH SS. rer. Merov. 6 (1913) 37-50; - BHL 6271 and nov. suppl.; M. Sepet, ‘Observations sur la légende de sainte Odile’, Bibliothèque de l’école des Chartes 63 (1902) 517-36 Text breaks off at fol. 84vb, l. 11 and continues on fol. 85rb, but text missing (ed. W. Levison , loc. cit., 41, l. 15-42, l. 10).

msItem.author: Ps.-Bede
msItem.title: Homiliae evangelii (extracts)
msItem.note: De divite: hom. 3. 104 (ed.: PL 94. 505B-06D; CPL 1368).

msItem.author: Honorius of Autun
msItem.title: Speculum ecclesiae (extract)
msItem.note: De S. Pelagia (ed.: PL 172. 913B-14D; Schneyer ii. 720ff).

msItem.title: Homilies and exempla
msItem.note: Miracles and exempla partly based on or excerpted from Caesarius of Heisterbach, Dialogus miraculorum and Liber octo miraculorum. Opening imperfect, editions as above.

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates. Authors quoted: Bernard of Clairvaux, Jerome, Augustine, Gregory the Great, Sixtus, and Alcuin.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles partly based on or excerpted from Caesarius of Heisterbach, Dialogus miraculorum and Liber octo miraculorum. Opening imperfect, editions as above.
(fol. 93a) A note on superbia and extracts from Bernard of Clairvaux.

msItem.title: Visio Tungdali
msItem.note: (ed. A. Wagner (Erlangen, 1882) 6, l. 18-40; - A. Wagner, ‘Zur Tundalusvision’, Anglia NF 8=20 (1896) 452-62, this MS. discussed at pp. 453f.; see also ‘Tundalus’ VL 9 (1995) 1142-46 [N. F. Palmer]). The present copy, which represents a very good text of the oldest version of the Tundalus vision, with some shortenings at the beginning, has textual affinities with MS. London, BM, Add. 11437; it breaks off after the description of the torments in hell, omitting the joys of paradise.

msItem.title: Visio Philiberti
msItem.note: (ed. T. G. v. Karajan, Frühlingsgabe für Freunde älterer Literatur (Vienna, 1839) 85, l. 9–98; T. Wright, The Latin poems commonly attributed to Walter Mapes (London, 1841; repr. Hildesheim, 1968) 95–106; E. du Méril, Poésies populaires latines antérieures au douzième siècle (Paris, 1843) 219, l. 6–229, l. 5; etc.; – T. Batiouchkof, ‘Le débat de l’âme et du corps’, Romania 20 (1891) 1–55, 513–78; Chevalier 29918; Little 148; Bloomfield 1862 & 3223, and suppl).

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.note: For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Vita S. Patricii
msItem.note: (Hardy, Materials, 1. 191a, this copy (incorrect folio no.); C. Plummer, Miscellanea hagiographica Hibernica, Subsidia Hagiographica 15 (Brussels, 1925) 253 (no. 292); L. Bieler, Codices Patriciani latini: a descriptive catalogue of Latin manuscripts relating to St. Patrick (Dublin, 1942) 45 (no. 58); incipit cf. BHL 6515). Unidentified text.

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.note: Excerpt ascribed to Bernard of Clairvaux, (fol. 101rb) sermons, and notes.

msItem.title: Saints' lives and legends
msItem.note: For full item listing, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles, including extracts from Vitas patrum, 5. 23 (ed.: PL 73. 879A–C; BHL 6527), Gregory the Great, Dialogi (Vita S. Benedicti)(ed.: PL 66. 142A–80A (selection); BHL 1102).

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates. Authors quoted: Bernard of Clairvaux, Jerome, Gregory the Great, Seneca the Younger and Ambrose.

msItem.title: Saints’ lives
msItem.note: Includes miracles, for listing see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates. Authors quoted: Augustine, Bernard of Clairvaux, Seneca the Younger, Gregory the Great, John Chrysostom and others.

msItem.title: Theological texts
msItem.note: For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Manuale
msItem.note: Preface (shortened), cap. 1-17 (pr. Strasbourg c.1476 (GW 2969), etc.; ed.: PL 40. 951-59 = PL 177. 171A-79D; Glorieux, Migne, 28; PLS 2. 1366; Römer ii/1. 122 (no. 15); ii/2. 276; Bloomfield 4957, and suppl.; CPPM 2. 3074).

msItem.title: Theological texts
msItem.note: Short tractates. For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles, the text breaks off; for the continuation see below, fol. 129ra (item 37).

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles. For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates. Authors quoted: Bernard of Clairvaux, Augustine and Biblical quotations from Job.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles and anecdotes, mostly based on or extracted from Caesarius of Heisterbach, Dialogus miraculorum.

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates. Authors/works quoted: Isidore of Seville, Seneca the Younger, Augustine, Ambrose and others.

msItem.author: Jacobus de Voragine
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: De quindecim signis diei iudicii, 1. 72-92, De adventu dni (ed.: Maggioni 1. 16f.; Gerhardt & Palmer, 15 Zeichen, 65f).

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates. Authors quoted: Gregory the Great, Augustine, Bernard of Clairvaux, Ambrose and others.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles. For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates, imperfect. Authors quoted: John Chrysostom, Jerome, Gregory the Great, Isidore of Seville and others.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles, continuation from fol. 129ra (item 28). Includes extracts from the Vitas patrum and Caesarius of Heisterbach, Dialogus miraculorum.

msItem.title: Interrogationes ad episcopos et praelatos
msItem.note: (Bloomfield 5539).

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles. For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.author: Henricus de Frimaria
msItem.title: Tractatus de vitiis
msItem.note: Abridged version (unpr. as such but the table of contents printed in Stroick, Friemar, 69-71; Zumkeller 337, 337n.; Bloomfield 6456, and suppl.).

msItem.title: Sermon
msItem.note: For incipit, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles, including extracts from the Vitas patrum. For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Two sermons
msItem.note: For incipits, see printed catalogue. Accompanied by (fol. 154vb) Admonitio regularis disciplinae (ed. M. Haverals, ‘Deux exhortations à la vie monastique de la “dévotion moderne”’, in Pascua mediaevalia. Studies voor Prof. Dr. J.M. De Smet, eds R. Lievens et al., Mediaevalia Lovaniensia ser. 1, 10 (Leuven 1983) 603–18, at pp. 611–13; Bloomfield suppl. 224a).

msItem.title: De duodecim gradibus humilitatis
msItem.note: Summary of Bernard of Clairvaux, De XII gradibus humilitatis (ed.: PL 182. 941A-72).

msItem.title: Grammatical treatise
msItem.note: Etymologies. Some identical with Isidore of Seville, Etymologiae (ed.: PL 82. 73-728C; ed. W. M. Lindsay, OCT (1985, the latest (5th) repr. of the 1st ed. 1911); - Stegmüller, RB, 5164; Díaz 122; CPL 1186).

msItem.title: Saints’ lives
msItem.note: For listing, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Treatise on pastoral care
msItem.note: De bono pastore (Six things that constitute a good priest).

msItem.title: Theological miscellany
msItem.note: (fols 156vb-159ra) Various texts: De confessione, luxuria, superbia,invidia, avaritia, accidia, gula, and De decem praeceptis.

msItem.title: Saint’s life
msItem.note: De S. Elizabeth.

msItem.title: Three sermons
msItem.note: For incipits, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Saints’ lives
msItem.note: Saints' lives, including Navigatio s. Brendani (ed. C. Selmer, Publications in Mediaeval Studies 16 (Notre Dame, 1959) 3-82, citing the present MS. at p. 111, no. 33 (e); incorrect date; G. Orlandi & Hardy, Materials, 1. 458, this copy (incorrect date: s. xv); BHL & BHL nov. suppl. 1437; incipit cf. also BHL 1447; J. F. Kenney, The sources for the early history of Ireland: ecclesiastical. An introduction and guide (New York, 1968, repr. 1993) 414f.; M. Esposito, ‘Sur la Navigatio sancti Brendani et sur ses versions italiennes’, Romania 64 (1938) 328-46, this copy at p. 333 (incorrect date); C. Strijbosch, The legend of St Brendan: a critical bibliography (Dublin, 2000), citing the present MS. at p. 17, incorrect folio nos and date). For listing, see printed catalogue.

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles, mostly based on or extracted from Caesarius of Heisterbach, Dialogus miraculorum.

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Auctoritates. Authors quoted: Augustine, Bernard of Clairvaux, Gregory the Great, Isidore of Seville and others.

msItem.author: Ps.-Theotimus
msItem.title: Passio s. Margaretae
msItem.note: With prologue and epilogue (ed.: Mombritius 2. 190-96; ed. F. M. Mack, EETS OS 193 (1934) 127-42; BHL & BHL nov. suppl. 5303; G. H. Gerould, ‘A new text of the Passio sanctae Margaritæ with some account of its Latin and English relations’, PMLA 39 (1924) 525-56, esp. pp. 525 547 (with edition)).

msItem.title: Commentary on the Lord's Prayer
msItem.note: De oratione dominica, commentary on the Lord’s prayer (Bloomfield 8255; cf. Barré, Homéliaires, 327 (M 140)).

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.note: Miracles, imperfect at the end. For listing, see printed catalogue.
(fol. 193va) De sancto Thoma Canthuariensi copied in a different, 15th-cent. hand.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fols 97, 124, 137 & 155) stitching preserved, in natural-coloured thread; (fols 118, 124 & 134) remnants of stitching (stitching holes); (fols 116 & 117) the outer margins reinforced with a parchment slip, with large stitching in plain thread; (fol. 193) the leaf in two separate halves, knotted together near the outer margin with plain thread; (fols 187r–193v) Remnants of previous binding furniture: up to three large rust marks in the outer margins, from fore-edge clasps or straps.
supportDesc.collation: i–iii 8 | iv & v 10 | vi 12 | vii & viii 8 | ix 10-1 | x 16-4 | xi 16-7 | xii 10-1 | xiii 12-1 | xiv 12 | xv 14-1 | xvi 8 | xvii 14-3 | xviii 8 | xix 10

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in ink, two columns, the number of lines varies strongly: c.44–71, ruled in crayon, ink or lead point. Ruled space c.138–57 93–108

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiii2, by one scribe, below the top line. Occasionally marginal annotations, corrections and paraphs in the hand of the scribe and in another, contemporary hand, as well as in a hand of s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse, in black ink.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-century ex-libris inscription at the upper margin of fol. 193v, boxed in, and faded now: ‘Iste liber est carthusiensium iuxta Magunciam’. Identifiable as B XV Qr in cat. ii
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris, dated 1638, at the lower half of fol. i verso
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 245–6 Quarto Catalogue, col. 247 Quarto Catalogue, p. 556 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 45

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 800–865

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
